message: I'm the founder of SpotSift, an LBS that helps professionals network at events using their mobile phone. I want to help make networking super-efficient by enabling users to search and discover the professional around them at events, publish business opportunities and connect in real-time.
We have an iPhone app (search for 'spotsift') and read more about us at www.spotsift.com.
Oh yeah, I'm building out a team so if you're interested in this space please contact me. :)

I think this could be a great idea, i really don't see any other app in the space, also with that said, there is one thing that i think that could make this even better, integrate with linkedin, i mean linkedin looks like that the perfect part to make this a killer app
and also think about another name
@thesteve I think the name could be improve didn't really make sense to me when I started playing with it
what do you think is wrong with the name?
this would be useful only at a professional event right?
@italiano40 i was just curious if you picked up on some negative connotation but you just don't think it accurately describes the service? fair enough
@italiano40 There's another app in this space as far as I know... http://shhmooze.com. There's probably space for more than one app though. Best of luck @freshfunk.
@thesteve i think it could be catchy or something that really grabs attention @micrypt and i never seen that but i just did a quick google search but that one looks good
@italiano40 It integrates with LinkedIn, at least during user creation. I plan on doing other LI integrations as is allowed by their terms and conditions.

@italiano40 Oh yeah and the name. It's not perfect but I must've gone through 1,000,000, all of which are taken. I'm not in the mood to pay through the nose for a domain name and I like having .com. My perfect name for the app would've been NetworkNow.
@equinox Yeah, I'm aiming at the professional vertical instead of purely social or dating or photos etc.

@italiano40 Yes, lol, there is probably space for 10 more apps. Meetup's mobile app allows check-ins but nothing much beyond that. Facebook is getting into checking into events, but they are obviously not professional. I haven't heard of shhmooze but thanks for pointing that out. There is a startup called unsocial that was on TechCrunch a while back but haven't heard anything about them since them.
@freshfunk you said you're building a team, I am assuming you want to start a startup? how many people are in the team now?
piloting events like the one on April 6 sound like a great idea for a location service. perhaps schedule another one?
@equinox Well, in my view, I've already started the startup. :) Currently, it is just me.
